title: Against Iran, France sides with Israel and the US
summary: France's positioning makes it more difficult for Paris to play the role of mediator in Lebanon.

title: Serhiy Hnezdilov, Ukrainian soldier: 'Avoiding the army has become a national sport'
summary: A voluntary 2019 recruit in the Donbas war, a 24-year-old soldier has now left his unit, protesting against the lack of prospects for demobilization and denouncing social inequalities that help some people avoid being drafted.

title: Israel hits Hezbollah intel HQ in Beirut, military says
summary: Israel has expanded its focus to secure its northern border and ensure the safe return of more than 60,000 people displaced by Hezbollah attacks over the past year.

title: US dockworkers to head back to work after tentative deal
summary: A Master Contract for US dockworkers has been extended until January 15, 2025, 'effective immediately,' a joint statement by the International Longshoremen's Association (ILA) and the United States Maritime Alliance (USMX) announced following a three-day strike.

title: Country singer Garth Brooks accused of rape in new lawsuit
summary: The suit, filed in Los Angeles, says Brooks filed a preemptive lawsuit in September in Mississippi. In the action, the plaintiff sought an injunction blocking 'extortionate conduct' and alleging the woman was seeking a multimillion-dollar payout.

title: Hurricane Helene death toll passes 210, the second most destructive storm in half a century
summary: More than half of the deaths were in flood-ravaged North Carolina, which is experiencing an unprecedented disaster described by some as post-apocalyptic. A compilation of official figures confirms 212 fatalities across North and South Carolina, Georgia, Florida, Tennessee and Virginia.

title: Israel army rescued Yazidi woman from Gaza after decade in captivity
summary: The army said the 21-year-old woman was rescued in a coordinated and complex operation this week that involved cooperation with the United States, Jordan and other international partners. In Washington, State Department spokesman Matthew Miller said the young woman was only 11 years old when she was 'kidnapped by ISIS in Iraq.'

title: Tunisia: Kais Saied, the embarrassing ally of European migration policy, ready for re-election
summary: Since the beginning of 2024, arrivals in Italy from Tunisia have fallen by 82%, according to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees. Although he denies it, the Tunisian head of state, the favorite in the elections scheduled for October 6, has become Europe's brutal border guard.

title: 'All We Imagine as Light': Three women wrapped in the illusions of Mumbai, India
summary: Winner of the Grand Prix at Cannes, Payal Kapadia's second feature film envelops the city in an incredible palette of reds and blues.

title: Ukraine is employing increasingly controversial methods for mobilization
summary: After the legal age for enlistment was lowered from 27 to 25, the pace of recruitment accelerated. But there is considerable criticism about violence by recruiters, the social disparities in the selection of recruits and the poor quality of training for new soldiers.

title: FIFA launches investigation, deferring decision on suspending Israel
summary: Following a Palestinian Football Association claim that the Israel Football Association had broken FIFA's discrimination rules, FIFA's council ordered an independent legal analysis and opened a discrimination investigation.

title: French jihadist linked to Charlie Hebdo attacks receives life sentence
summary: Peter Cherif, who spent seven years in Yemen with Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, was suspected of having trained Chérif Kouachi, one of the perpetrators of the January 7, 2015, Charlie Hebdo terrorist attack.

title: Palestinian health ministry says 18 killed in Israeli strike on West Bank
summary: The Israeli army confirmed the strike on the town in the northern West Bank, describing it as a joint operation carried out by the Shin Bet internal security service and the air force, according to a statement by the military.

title: In southern Lebanon, Israel and Hezbollah clash on the ground
summary: On Wednesday, the Israeli army announced the death of eight of its men in fighting with the Shiite movement. Six people were killed when Israel bombed one of its relief centers in the heart of Beirut.

title: Serge Gainsbourg museum in receivership one year after opening
summary: According to an investigation, unpaid bills, dubious management and legal disputes have dogged Maison Gainsbourg, a museum devoted to one of France's most loved musicians.

title: Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares doesn't rule out retirement in 2026
summary: Stellantis' CEO visited the Sochaux plant on Thursday, October 3, with the French minister delegate for industry, Marc Ferracci.

title: The slow atrophy of unions in the US, despite Biden
summary: Despite his constant – and unprecedented – support for blue-collar workers, Joe Biden has not succeeded in reviving a union dynamic in his country. A losing bet that proves a president can't do everything, explains Le Monde's Jean-Michel Bezat in his column.

title: France and Madagascar begin 'historic' human remains restitution process
summary: As per a December 2023 French law on repatriations of human remains, a joint scientific committee will review Madagascar's request to have the skull of King Toera, beheaded under French colonial rule, returned.

title: 'The only way for Netanyahu to achieve his goals is the use of force, with total disregard for international law'
summary: In an article for 'Le Monde,' political scientist Jean-Paul Chagnollaud warns of the risk of 'an enormous humanitarian catastrophe' following the 'all-out war' being waged by Benjamin Netanyahu, who refuses to accept any form of diplomacy.

title: In Lens, an X-ray scan reveals the secrets of an Egyptian mummy from the Louvre
summary: An X-ray examination at the Pas-de-Calais hospital has revealed more about a scribe who died almost 3,000 years ago.

title: 'To have any chance of governing, the Democratic Party must attract a portion of voters with conservative values'
summary: Since 1981, Republican and Democratic voters in the US have differed more in religious and moral values than in their opinions on economic or social inequality, observes economist Pierre-Cyrille Hautcœur.

title: Giorgia Meloni pushes Italy's migration strategy as a model
summary: The head of Italy's post-fascist government is working to outsource European border control to countries on the southern shores of the Mediterranean, particularly Tunisia, at the cost of serious human rights violations.

title: Anti-Trump Republican Liz Cheney rallies with Harris in key battleground
summary: Vice President Harris was joined onstage in the swing state of Wisconsin by the former congresswoman and daughter of conservative former vice president Dick Cheney.

title: Kamala Harris appeals to shared patriotism in campaign stop with Liz Cheney
summary: At a rally for the Democratic candidate on Thursday, Dick Cheney's daughter called for 'putting patriotism ahead of partisanship.' The former elected official is one of the few voices within the Republican Party to consistently speak out against Donald Trump.

title: US dockworkers win their showdown with freight giants, in the heat of the presidential campaign
summary: After three days on strike, the unions won a pay rise of 62% over six years. A victory hailed by President Joe Biden.

title: French PM Barnier asserts change of governing style
summary: In a prime-time TV interview, Michel Barnier sought to distance himself from how President Emmanuel Macron has led the country for 7 years. He held firm on plans to hike taxes for the wealthiest in order to reduce the deficit and impose strict measures on immigration.
